p: Clinical symptoms: acute vomiting, followed after a few hours of heavy diarrhoea with rapid dehydration and rapid, cholera-like diarrhoea with development of dehydration and loss of electrolytes, especially in the smallest children. Sunken fontanelle in infants, hollow orbital cavity and standing skin folds are classic signs of severe dehydration in toddlers. Infants/toddlers are admitted to hospitals for observation and rehydration.
